result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian K Perry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.   **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
---------------------

No alcohol.  No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
---------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.  The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.  Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
---------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
---------------------

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
---------------------
Maintain full time employment or school.

timeConds.notes: with work release privileges to commence on or before 7-29-2015 at 8:00 a.m. Conditional jail time may be served in Milwaukee County. Court authorizes electronic monitoring if approved by the facility.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian K Perry
